intro: Tanacetum oresbium, commonly known as the meadow cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that are often surrounded by white or pale green ray florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. Tanacetum oresbium is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
